channel.title: Comments on: SQL Cruise Caribbean 2015: More Than A Cruise With Classes. Much More.
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Jes Borland
item.dc:creator: Jes Borland
item.description: Jeff, good luck with the PowerShell Cruise planning! I believe there have been 15-20 attendees on each SQL Cruise. The class sizes are kept small for maximum interaction with the technical leads and other attendees.
item.content:encoded: Jeff, good luck with the PowerShell Cruise planning! I believe there have been 15-20 attendees on each SQL Cruise. The class sizes are kept small for maximum interaction with the technical leads and other attendees.

item.title: By: Jeff Langdon
item.dc:creator: Jeff Langdon
item.description:
Hey Jes,
I am the co-coordinator for the Inaugural PowerShell cruise (poshcruise.org) June 18th - 25th. We are trying to gauge attendance. Would you mind giving us a "ballpark" idea of how many attendees/speakers there were at any of the SQL Cruises? From a planning perspective, it would be helpful to know
Thanks,
Jeff
item.content:encoded:
Hey Jes,

I am the co-coordinator for the Inaugural PowerShell cruise (poshcruise.org) June 18th – 25th. We are trying to gauge attendance. Would you mind giving us a “ballpark” idea of how many attendees/speakers there were at any of the SQL Cruises? From a planning perspective, it would be helpful to know

Thanks,

Jeff

item.title: By: Tim Ford
item.dc:creator: Tim Ford
item.description: Jes this is absolutely wonderful. You definitely captured what we hope happens as a result of #SQLCruise and are looking forward to you speaking on the next Caribbean #SQLCruise in 2016! You Rock!
item.content:encoded: Jes this is absolutely wonderful. You definitely captured what we hope happens as a result of #SQLCruise and are looking forward to you speaking on the next Caribbean #SQLCruise in 2016! You Rock!
